bibl.title: The Civilization Passed down on Papyrus: Booksellers of Ancient Greece and Rome. [En japonais.]
bibl.note: Explores various questions about the ancient world of writing - the kinds of works produced, the type of people who read them, how expensive they were, whether or not there was borrowing or lending of books, whether or not there were zealous "book collectors", and how slave labor was involved with publishing activities.
